msbt.message: They say spring is a great time to try something fresh.I've been giving serious thought to picking up a new hobby
I usually have to ease myself into the heat of this season by keeping a lot of iced tea handy to sip on.
This is the perfect season for curling up with a good book!I'm thinking about branching out to read books in genres I usually avoid.
This time of year, I start craving piping-hot soups and chowders.I've been trying to recreate a stew that I grew up with, ever since Dad shared his recipe with me recently.
Can't you just feel the change of season in the air? Flowers sprouting up everywhere, warm breezes

A lot of romance stories are set in this season. School breaks, beach vacations, love under the sun But most of those stories play up summer romances as fleeting flings that end on a bittersweet note.
This is a wistful and sentimental time of year. Crisp breezes, leaves falling and crunching under your feet Maybe I should try channeling all of these thoughts into some poetry.
I'm trying to keep warm by staying on the move. More walks for me!
Have you noticed more bugs around now that it's getting warmer?I can identify with them, since the blossoms and nice weather have me popping outside a lot more, myself!
Doesn't the island smell great right now? , so sweet
They say it's important to drink a lot of water in warm weather, so I try to remind myself to stay hydrated.
I read that more smells carry in the air when it's warmer. Maybe that's why it smells so good outside now!
It might be getting cool again but, , sometimes it feels good to bundle up.
I smell woolly sweaters, spiced tea, and crunchy leaves, and I love it!
I thought I was bundled up warm enough when I left my house but, , is it chilly out here!
I think I can actually smell the snow! Or maybe my nose is just frozen
